Steam sets the prices for Steam sales. You'd have to ask them why.
Are you entirely positive about that?

It feels like a good thing that it's more expensive. And it should be. Squad has supported KSP far beyond the expectations of most game developers. Amazingly, they've been releasing new features - for free - in the main game past the 1.0 release for the past... ~5 years. That's half a decade of more support on top of the 4 years it took to get to 1.0.

They've worked on it for nearly a decade and added feature after feature and improvement after improvement. The development of all of these new features and game improvements isn't cheap. It's expensive in terms of engineering time and costs. Someone has to pay for that - something has to pay for that. Shouldn't we be lining up to pay for these DLC's no matter what the price so that they keep working on our beloved game?
